702656f-c.text:
24th Street, east from Third Avenue. Near Fourth Avenue is the Polish Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Czenstochowa.

View 2 shows the World War shrine at the church.

View 3 shows two small homes in the interior of the block near
the rear of the church.

P. L. Sperr  July 22, 1940

702259f-a.text:
1. 14th St., west from 3rd Ave., Brooklyn.
Nov. 15, 1941
2. West side of 3rd Ave., north of 14th St., Brooklyn.
Nov. 15, 1941
P.L. Sperr, photographer

702541f-a.text:
14th Street, north side, west from Third Avenue. These houses are No. 119 to 99.
April 21, 1941
P. L. Sperr

702260f-a.text:
1.  3rd Avenue, east side, south from 14th to 15th Streets. One of the houses is boarded up. Another three-story frame house
stood where the clearance is.
P. L. Sperr  April 21, 1941

2.  3rd Ave., north from 15th St., B'klyn.
Nov. 15, 1941
P. L. Sperr, photographer
Neg. # 2688
